titles.title: To adjust the boundaries of the Gulf Islands National Seashore to include Cat Island, Mississippi.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-447.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 257.

action.text: Mr. Hansen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2541.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Subcommittee on National Parks, Historic Preservation, and Recreation. Hearings held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Historic Preservation and Recreation
committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 11/16/1999--Passed House amended. Amends Federal law which established the Gulf Islands National Seashore to include within such Seashore Cat Island, Mississippi, if acquired by the Secretary of the Interior from a willing seller. Authorizes the Secretary to acquire from a willing seller: (1)an easement over the Boddie Family Tract on Cat Island in order to implement an agreement concerning the development and use of such parcel; and (2) certain lands and interests within one mile seaward of Cat Island.Authorizes the Secretary to enter into agreements: (1) with the State of Mississippi for managing resources and providing law enforcement assistance on Cat Island and one mile seaward therefrom; and (2) with the owners of the Boddie Tract for effecting the agreement concerning its development and use.Authorizes appropriations to acquire lands and submerged lands on and adjacent to Cat Island.
